abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability likely, and institutional development impacts
            are moderate. Several lessons are drawn from the project.
            Although broad consensus supports the viability of a Road
            Maintenance Fund (RMF) to stabilize funding sources for road
            maintenance, it is suggested that the introduction of RMFs
            can be politically sensitive, and that such measures are
            more likely to succeed when undertaken in the context of an
            improving economy. It is also arguable that road maintenance
            should not be financed through Bank loans, but as indicated
            above, in times of economic difficulties, lending for
            periodic road maintenance, would prevent deterioration of
            road assets, avoid significant increases in trade, and
            business transaction costs, in the form of higher vehicle
            operating/transport costs on bad roads, and maintain an
            essential element for economic growth. Realistic, and
            attainable objectives should form the basis of a
            project's design, and, this design should be such, that
            significant disbursement may occur during the first year of
            implementation, i.e., for infrastructure projects, this
            requires that major technical designs, and procurement
            documents be completed by Board presentation, with actual
            bidding commencing prior to effectiveness; thus deadline
            pressures should be resisted, to avoid significant risks in
            quality at entry, and/or unnecessary commitment fees for the Borrower.

5079380.trustfund: TF033168-JORDAN - TRANSPORT,TF033834-JORDAN - HIGHWAYS TRANSPORT,TF032277-JORDAN - THIRD TRANSPORT,TF020350-DANISH CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND
5079380.majtheme: Trade and integration,Financial and private sector development

abstracts.cdata!:
The project will promote a viable and
            efficient transport sector by rehabilitating and upgrading
            road arteries critical for foreign trade and transit
            traffic.  The project will also enhance service life for
            road investments by supporting lower axle load limits for
            trucks, more appropriate and stronger road pavement
            construction and better maintenance.  Technical assistance
            to review institutional arrangements and develop the
            capacity and capability of sector agencies to ensure
            sustainable improvements of roads and operational efficiency
            and financial viability of the railway will also be an
            important objective.
